title: Research scenario set stress study - application

content.description:
Dr. Salim recruited a group of high school students who had reported experiencing high stress over the last 6 months. The students took a self-reported 10-point stress inventory before the study.
They were then randomly divided between a group that had no changes to their current daily schedule and another group that participated in a daily 20-minute mindfulness exercise. 
After eight weeks, all students were asked to self-report stress levels again by completing the same 10-point scale. Those in the mindfulness exercise group had a statistically significant decrease in their stress levels, while those who continued their daily routine had no change in self-reported stress.
content.question: Ralph participated in Dr. Salim’s study. In addition to taking several advanced courses, Ralph has a part-time job, relationship challenges, and an unpredictable home life. Which of the following might Ralph experience as a long-term result of these stressors?

choices.label: Increased ability to focus on multiple tasks

skill.text: 1.A: Apply psychological perspectives, theories, concepts, and research findings to a scenario.
